content: Tsagkatakis Grigorios Grigorios Tsagkatakis Institute of Computer Science Foundation for Research and Technology - Hellas (FORTH) Home Publications Research Projects Contact My name is Grigorios Tsagkatakis and IÂ  currently serving as an Assistant Professor at the Computer Science Department (CSD) of the University of Crete. I am also an associate researcher at the Signal Processing Lab (SPL) of the Institute of Computer Science (ICS), Foundation for Research and Technology Hellas (FORTH). I hold a BSc (2005) and an MSc (2007) from the School of Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Technical University of Crete, Greece. I was awarded my PhD from the Center of Imaging Science, Rochester Institute of Technology, NY, USA (2011). Between 2019-2022, I was a Marie SkÅodowska-Curie fellow working with Prof. Mahta Moghaddam, head of the Microwave Systems, Sensors, and Imaging Lab (MiXIL) at the University of Southern California (USC) on the CALCHAS project. Research Interests Signal and Image Processing, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Compressed Sensing, Remote Sensing, Astrophysics. Â News Together with Dr. Jean-Luc Starck, we are organizing the (ADA-X), the 10th Astronomical Data Analysis Summer School which will take place on September 18-22, 2023 at Hersonissos, Crete, Greece. Our proposal with Prof. Moghaddam (USC) on "Fusion of Passive and Active Microwave Remote Sensing Data: An Integrative Framework for Resolution Enhancement Using Physics-Based Modeling, In-Situ Observations, and Deep Neural Networks" has been accepted for funding by the NASA Research Opportunities in Space and Earth Science (ROSES-2018): Remote Sensing Theory for Earth Science. Together with M. Jaber (NantOmics, USA) and M. Yousefhussien (General Electric Global Research, USA), we are organizing the Food and Agricultural Imaging Systems conference on February, 2021. More information in the website We are organizing the Computational Intelligence in Remote Sensing and Astrophysics (CIRSA) workshop on July 17-19, 2019 at FORTH. More information in the website I wll be teaching a class on Deep Learning in astronomy in the 2019 Summer School for Astrostatistics, Department of Physics, University of Crete.
